result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with J. Mihor.

Defendant to undergo an Anger Managment Program and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:44 p.m. Defendant Kelly A. Miller in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty La Fond. Statement by DE. Court orders - S/W 18 mos Probation - Conditions: Anger management and follow through, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C/C w/ J. Mihor, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Bar Prohibition modified for purposes of employment only - Granite Inn Supper Club

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Kelly A. Miller in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lafond requesting another STC as she was just recently appointed.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:20 am.

Case re-called @ 3:27 p.m. Defendant Kelly A. Miller in court with attorney Britteny Mae LaFond.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion filed by the victim for the no contact condition of bond be removed. Statement by ADA Anderson - there has been no contact with the victim with the exception of the letter filed by the victim. The court will amend the bond to no violent or confrontational contact with the victim.

ADDRESS INFO for Kelly A. Miller
Current: W4956 S Oakhaven Circle, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2015)
Prior: N1891 Silver Oaks Lane, Wautoma, WI 54982

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 2:03 p.m. Defendant Kelly A. Miller in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. NGP entered. Statement by ADA Anderson regarding bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting the bond be amended to a signature bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
